briefdescription.para: The container type.
The number type of the coordinates of the points of the polygon.
The point type of the polygon.
The type of a segment between two points of the polygon.

description.para: The following types denote iterators that allow to traverse the vertices and edges of a polygon.
Since a polygon can be viewed as a circular as well as a linear data structure both circulators and iterators are defined.

simplesect.para: At least conceptually, the circulators and iterators are non-mutable. The enforcement depends on preprocessor flags.

The iterator category is in all cases bidirectional, except for Vertex_iterator, which has the same iterator category as Container::iterator. In fact all of them should have the same iterator category as Container::iterator. However, due to compiler problems this is currently not possible.

briefdescription.para: vertex iterator type
a range type to iterate over the vertices
vertex circulator type
edge iterator type
a range type to iterate over the vertices
edge circular type
Creates an empty polygon.
Creates an empty polygon.
Creates a polygon with vertices from the sequence defined by the range [first,last).

detaileddescription.para: The value type of InputIterator must be Point_2.

briefdescription.para: Acts as *i = q, except that that would be illegal because the iterator is not mutable.
Inserts the vertex q before i.

detaileddescription.para: The return value points to the inserted vertex.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the vertex q before i.

detaileddescription.para: The return value points to the inserted vertex.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the vertices in the range [first, last) before i.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of points in the range [first,last) must be Point_2.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the vertices in the range [first, last) before i.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of points in the range [first,last) must be Point_2.

briefdescription.para: Has the same semantics as p.insert(p.vertices_end(), q).
Erases the vertex pointed to by i.
Erases the vertex pointed to by i.
Erases the vertices in the range [first, last).
Erases the vertices in the range [first, last).
Reverses the orientation of the polygon.

detaileddescription.para: The vertex pointed to by p.vertices_begin() remains the same.

description.para: The following methods of the class Polygon_2 return circulators and iterators that allow to traverse the vertices and edges.

briefdescription.para: Returns a constant iterator that allows to traverse the vertices of the polygon.
Returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.
returns the range of vertices.
Returns a constant circulator that allows to traverse the vertices of the polygon.
Returns a non-mutable iterator that allows to traverse the edges of the polygon.
Returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.
returns the range of edges.
Returns a non-mutable circulator that allows to traverse the edges of the polygon.
Returns whether this is a simple polygon.
Returns whether this is convex.
Returns the orientation.

detaileddescription.para:
If the number of vertices p.size() < 3 then COLLINEAR is returned.
p.is_simple().

briefdescription.para: Returns ON_POSITIVE_SIDE, or ON_NEGATIVE_SIDE, or ON_ORIENTED_BOUNDARY, depending on where point q is.
Returns the symbolic constant ON_BOUNDED_SIDE, ON_BOUNDARY or ON_UNBOUNDED_SIDE, depending on where point q is.
Returns the smallest bounding box containing this polygon.
Returns the signed area of the polygon.

detaileddescription.para: This means that the area is positive for counter clockwise polygons and negative for clockwise polygons.

briefdescription.para: Returns the leftmost vertex of the polygon with the smallest x-coordinate.
Returns the rightmost vertex of the polygon with the largest x-coordinate.
Returns the topmost vertex of the polygon with the largest y-coordinate.
Returns the bottommost vertex of the polygon with the smallest y-coordinate.

description.para: For convenience we provide the following Boolean functions:

briefdescription.para: returns orientation() == COUNTERCLOCKWISE
returns orientation() == CLOCKWISE
returns orientation() == COLLINEAR
returns oriented_side(q) == ON_POSITIVE_SIDE
returns oriented_side(q) == ON_NEGATIVE_SIDE
returns bounded_side(q) == ON_BOUNDARY
returns bounded_side(q) == ON_BOUNDED_SIDE
returns bounded_side(q) == ON_UNBOUNDED_SIDE
Returns a (const) reference to the i-th vertex.
Returns a (const) reference to the i-th vertex.
Returns a reference to the i-th vertex.
Returns a reference to the i-th vertex.
Returns the i-th edge.
Returns the number of vertices of the polygon.
Returns size() == 0.
Returns a const reference to the sequence of vertices of the polygon.
Returns a reference to the sequence of vertices of the polygon.
Returns an iterator to the first vertex of the polygon.
Returns an iterator to the element after the last vertex of the polygon.
Returns a const iterator to the first vertex of the polygon.
Returns a const iterator to the element after the last vertex of the polygon.
Resizes the container. Calls container().resize(s).
Calls container().reserve(s) if this is available for Container.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Traits_P, Container1_P > &p1, const Polygon_2< Traits_P, Container2_P > &p2)
memberdef.name: operator==

briefdescription.para: Test for equality: two polygons are equal iff there exists a cyclic permutation of the vertices of p2 such that they are equal to the vertices of p1.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the template argument Container of p1 and p2 may be different.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Polygon_2< Traits_P, Container1_P > &p1, const Polygon_2< Traits_P, Container2_P > &p2)
memberdef.name: operator!=

briefdescription.para: Test for inequality.
Returns the image of the polygon p under the transformation t.

description.para: The information output in the std::iostream is the number of points followed by the output of the coordinates of the vertices.

briefdescription.para: Reads a polygon from stream is and assigns it to p.

simplesect.para: The extract operator must be defined for Point_2.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the polygon p into the stream os.

simplesect.para: The insert operator must be defined for Point_2.

briefdescription.para: The class Polygon_2 implements polygons.

detaileddescription.para: The Polygon_2 is parameterized by a traits class and a container class. The latter can be any class that fulfills the requirements for an STL container, and has a function resize() that takes an std::size_t as argument. It defaults to the std::vector class.

The methods is_simple(), is_convex(), orientation(), oriented_side(), bounded_side(), bbox(), area(), left_vertex(), right_vertex(), top_vertex() and bottom_vertex() are all implemented using the algorithms on sequences of 2D points. See the corresponding global functions for information about which algorithms were used and what complexity they have.
